alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carroll, northeastern Heard and northwestern Coweta Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 523 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Lowell, or 7 miles south of Carrollton. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Whitesburg, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Clem, Plant Yates, Byers Crossroads, Lowell, Plant Wansley, Seaton Lake, and Handy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
